issues.description: The problem statement (UML and text) and the template expect Farm.singFarmSong() and its helper singFarmSongVerse(Animal) to print the song (void return type). The solution implements these methods to return String (singFarmSong(): String and singFarmSongVerse(Animal): String) instead of printing directly. This is a structural mismatch: the return types in the solution do not match the specification and template, and the problem explicitly requires printing the song. Students comparing the solution with the task or tests that inspect printed output may be confused about whether to implement printing (void) or building/returning a String.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the solution match the specification and template: change singFarmSong() to return void and perform printing inside it, and change singFarmSongVerse(Animal) to return void and print the verse directly (or have singFarmSong call the void helper). Alternatively, if the intended design is to build and return the song text as String, update the problem statement UML, description and the template method signatures/documentation to specify returning String rather than printing. Prefer aligning the solution to the current problem/template (void + printing) to avoid breaking tests that expect printed output.
